attributes.additional_details: Students are living in fear - I think we can all agree on that. Covid-19 is ramped through universities, lots of students are isolating & the ones who aren't, are worrying about catching this killer virus. In the meantime they are paying £9250 a year for the privilege of telling lectures how to use Microsoft teams, begging the university internet doesn't drop out for the second team this seminar and waiting for the live stream to unfreeze and work out how much they've missed. BUT it's our fault?
attributes.background: We want the government to partially refund students' tuition fees, this is because all learning is done on-line which not the same experience as the one we're paying for.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Require universities to partially refund tuition fees for 20/21 due to Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324762

Lower university tuition fees for students until online teaching ends: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552911

Government subsidise this year's university tuition fees: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552814

Implement support for university students during Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554299
